data.name: Scott Bader
data.description:
Scott Bader is an employee-owned global manufacturer of advanced composites, structural adhesives and functional polymers. Established in 1921, we have a century of expertise in manufacturing high-quality, innovative products for a variety of markets around the world. Scott Bader now employs 800 people across 7 manufacturing sites and 18 offices worldwide.

Scott Bader is committed to expanding its global reach, with recent ventures including North America, India, Japan, and Australia, while continuing to build on its reputation for innovation, outstanding quality and technical expertise.

Click here to see the industry shows you can visit Scott Bader at this year:

https://www.scottbader.com/dates-for-your-diary/

data.name: Crystic
data.description: Crystic® Resins have been developing for over 70 years to meet your application needs.

data.name: Texicryl
data.description: Texicryl® emulsion used to enhance the workability and technical performance of products being supplied into the building and decoration market.A diverse range of thickeners and binders for the Artist Colors market. It can also be used in water-based styrene acrylic emulsion polymers and solid resins specifically developed for graphic art applications, as a rheology modifiers for Hand Cleanser applications.With over 60 years’ experience, our range of PVA / acrylic binders and inverse emulsion thickeners deliver high performance in textile and furnishing products.

data.name: Crestomer
data.description: Crestomer®  adhesives are used in a wide range of demanding applications in a variety of markets. The key features and benefits for customers are structural adhesives, considerable weight savings versus traditional GRP joining techniques, excellent impact and fatigue performance and low VOC emissions.

data.name: Crestapol
data.description: Crestapol® intelligent resin technology is a series of low viscosity urethane acrylate based resins designed for infusion, pultrusion and closed mold applications.

data.name: Crestamould
data.description: High performance matched tooling systems

data.name: Crestafix
data.description: Crestafix bonding pastes are used in a wide range of applications, in a variety of markets. The key features and benefits to customers are wide range of densities, low shrinkage, range of working times, ease of application and color change.

data.name: Texipol
data.description: Scott Bader’s Texipol® range of rheology modifiers can be used in a variety of water-based formulations.A diverse range of thickeners and binders for the Artist Colors market.Texicryl® and Texipol® emulsions to enhance the workability and technical performance of products being supplied into the building and decoration market.With over 60 years’ experience, our range of PVA / acrylic binders and inverse emulsion thickeners deliver high performance in textile and furnishing products.

properties.name: INCI Name
items: Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Shell Powder

data.name: Texipol 63-513
data.description: Texipol 63-513 is a next generation inverse emulsion synthetic thickener based on a significant proportion of bio-derived content. It imparts pseudoplastic rheology to aqueous compositions and is supplied as a pre-neutralized dispersion, as the sodium salt of an acrylic based polymer. Texipol 63-513 shows broad pH compatibility.

data.name: Crestapol® 1260 Urethane Acrylate Resin
data.description: Crestapol® 1260 Urethane Acrylate Resin is a low-viscosity urethane acrylate type resin. It is suitable for infusion, resin transfer molding (RTM), and similar processes at room temperature. This product can be infused at vacuum levels down to -1.0 bar. It produces laminates with high strength, toughness, and exceptional water and hydrolysis resistance.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-602
data.description: Texicryl® 13-602 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in flexible fillers, caulks, sealant applications and architectural coatings. It enhances the workability and technical performance of many products. It meets all environmental demands, such as low VOC, APEO-free and formaldehyde-free with no compromise on quality and performance.

data.name: Crestakyd® 10-1066
data.description: Crestakyd® 10-1066 is a fast drying alkyd that has excellent brushability and flow characteristics, as well as good gloss retention and weathering resistance. This long oil air drying alkyd can be used for economical decorative and do-it-yourself paints, including primers, topcoats, and varnishes.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-812
data.description: Texicryl® 13-812 is an alkali swellable emulsion designed for water-based printing ink formulations. It has excellent rub resistance and transfer properties. It is designed for use in flexographic inks for corrugated board. It is also suitable as a pigment grinding medium and let down vehicle.

data.name: Texipol 63-510
data.description: Texipol 63-510 is an inverse emulsion thickener that imparts a highly pseudoplastic rheology to aqueous based compositions. It is supplied as a pre-neutralized dispersion, as the sodium salt of an acrylic copolymer and shows thickening over a very wide pH range of 2 - 12.

data.name: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE679-03PA
data.description: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE679-03PA is a pre-accelerated, DCPD modified, vinyl ester resin developed for use as a infusion resin with a wide range of gel times with various catalysts. It has excellent blister resistance and significantly reduces the occurrence of print through, to produce durable moldings with an enhanced surface finish.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-503
data.description: Texicryl® 13-503 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for the formulation of printing inks for application to non absorbent, low surface energy substrates. It is used in the formulation of printing inks for substrates such as polyethylene, polypropylene and various foils.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-217
data.description: Texicryl® 13-217 is an APEO free self-crosslinking acrylic copolymer emulsion characterised by a soft film giving, after crosslinking, a high resistance to washing and to primed or printed fabrics. It is ideal for the manufacturing of non woven fabrics and as flocking adhesive by spraying, in full bath or by foaming.

data.seo_description: Scott Bader is an employee-owned global manufacturer of advanced composites, structural adhesives and functional polymers. Established in 1921, we have a century of expertise in manufacturing high-qua

featured_products.name: Crestabond® M1-05 Structural Adhesive
featured_products.description: Crestabond® M1-05 Structural Adhesive is a toughened, two-component 10:1 MMA structural adhesive that is designed for bonding a wide range of substrates.

featured_products.name: Crestabond® M1-60HV/2 Structural Adhesive
featured_products.description: Crestabond® M1-60HV/2 is a toughened, two-component 10:1 acrylic adhesive designed for bonding composites, thermoplastics, and metals.

featured_products.name: Crestomer® 1152PA Structural Adhesive
featured_products.description: Crestomer® 1152PA Structural Adhesive provides high performance and is designed for demanding applications. Greatly reduces styrene emissions, and it improves cosmetics.

featured_products.name: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE 679PA
featured_products.description: Crystic® Vinyl Ester Resin VE 679PA is a pre-accelerated, thixotropic, DCPD modified, vinyl ester laminating and tooling resin with excellent surface finish.

featured_products.name: Crestapol® 1250 Urethane Acrylate Resin
featured_products.description: Crestapol® 1250 Urethane Acrylate Resin is a low-viscosity urethane acrylate resin. It's designed for maximum wet out for pultruding fiberglass, carbon fiber, and other fibers

featured_products.name: Texique® HE10
featured_products.description: Texique® HE10 is a new bio-based high performance thickener for the personal care market. It is produced from 62% naturally derived ingredients, none of which are animal-based

featured_products.name: Texique® CS-32
featured_products.description: Texique® CS-32 is an aqueous solution of a naturally derived cationic polysaccharide produced from food grade potato starch that has not been genetically modified.

featured_products.name: Texique® CS-P
featured_products.description: Texique® CS-P is an easy to use modified film forming cationic starch derivative, produced from food grade potato starch that has not been genetically modified.

featured_products.name: Crestafire® GCS 1005PA
featured_products.description: Crestafire® GCS 1005PA is a pre-accelerated, low smoke fire retardant intumescent polyester-based gelcoat designed to be applied by spray in a thin layer of 500µm.

data.name: Texicryl
data.html_description: Texicryl® emulsion used to enhance the workability and technical performance of products being supplied into the building and decoration market.A diverse range of thickeners and binders for the Artist Colors market. It can also be used in water-based styrene acrylic emulsion polymers and solid resins specifically developed for graphic art applications, as a rheology modifiers for Hand Cleanser applications.With over 60 years’ experience, our range of PVA / acrylic binders and inverse emulsion thickeners deliver high performance in textile and furnishing products.
data.text_description: Texicryl® emulsion used to enhance the workability and technical performance of products being supplied into the building and decoration market.A diverse range of thickeners and binders for the Artist Colors market. It can also be used in water-based styrene acrylic emulsion polymers and solid resins specifically developed for graphic art applications, as a rheology modifiers for Hand Cleanser applications.With over 60 years’ experience, our range of PVA / acrylic binders and inverse emulsion thickeners deliver high performance in textile and furnishing products.
data.seo_description: View all Scott Bader Texicryl products on Knowde.com. Quickly and easily request a quote, get samples, and download data sheets.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-602
data.description: Texicryl® 13-602 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in flexible fillers, caulks, sealant applications and architectural coatings. It enhances the workability and technical performance of many products. It meets all environmental demands, such as low VOC, APEO-free and formaldehyde-free with no compromise on quality and performance.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-812
data.description: Texicryl® 13-812 is an alkali swellable emulsion designed for water-based printing ink formulations. It has excellent rub resistance and transfer properties. It is designed for use in flexographic inks for corrugated board. It is also suitable as a pigment grinding medium and let down vehicle.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-308
data.description: Texicryl® 13-308 is an alkali soluble emulsion designed as a thickener for water-based formulations. It can be used in the formulation of ceramic tile adhesives, paints, waterborne coating systems and for use in EN 12004-1and2: 2017 D1 CTAs, a wide range of building adhesives and highly filled coatings.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-318
data.description: Texicryl® 13-318 is a hydrophobically modified alkali swellable emulsion designed for use as a rheology modifier in waterbased formulations. It is highly effective in modifying viscosities at low shear rates to avoid both settling and sagging. This emulsion can be used in cartidge products and construction adhesives.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-503
data.description: Texicryl® 13-503 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for the formulation of printing inks for application to non absorbent, low surface energy substrates. It is used in the formulation of printing inks for substrates such as polyethylene, polypropylene and various foils.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-601
data.description: Texicryl® 13-601 is a pure acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in both interior and exterior coating applications. It is designed for use in the formulation of solvent free decorative coatings with excellent durability and low dirt pick up. Other applications include artist’s colors and hobby paints.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-217
data.description: Texicryl® 13-217 is an APEO free self-crosslinking acrylic copolymer emulsion characterised by a soft film giving, after crosslinking, a high resistance to washing and to primed or printed fabrics. It is ideal for the manufacturing of non woven fabrics and as flocking adhesive by spraying, in full bath or by foaming.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-400
data.description: Texicryl® 13-400 is a formaldehyde free, cationic emulsion binder, specially designed for textile applications. It has been specially designed for textile applications using processes like pigment dyeing, mordant and printing. The product benefits are high crock-fastness, washing performance, excellent color yield and soft handle.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-313
data.description: Texicryl® 13-313 is an alkali swellable thickener designed for water-based formulations. It is highly effective in modifying viscosities at low shear rates to avoid both settling and sagging. It has been designed for use in the formulation of textured coatings, woodstains, paints and waterborne coating systems.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-687
data.description: Texicryl® 13-687 is a high performance water based, adhesion promoted pure acrylic emulsion, which has been specifically developed for use in high performance coatings for interior and exterior applications. This polymer is in line with “green technology” as it is APEO free, max. 0.1% VOC and has a low odor emulsion.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-809
data.description: Texicryl® 13-809 is a styrene acrylic emulsion polymer designed for high gloss, water-based overprint varnishes and heat resistant inks. This styrene acrylic binder has been designed to provide superb clarity, water resistance, heat resistance, gloss etc. It can be used as deblocking modifier.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-074
data.description: Texicryl® 13-074 is an APEO free styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion which has been developed for use in mixes containing portland cement for flooring applications. It imparts a higher degree of flexibility and also acts as a soft binder used in fabric glue formulations for tissues and papers.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-824
data.description: Texicryl® 13-824 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion that can be coalesced to form a solvent and plasticiser resistant film. This hard non-film forming emulsion shows excellent adhesion to vinyl and non-absorbent susbstrates. It has been developed for the formulation of plasticiser resistant inks and is suitable for PVC flooring and wallpaper inks.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-070
data.description: Texicryl® 13-070 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed primarily as a binder for D1 ceramic tile adhesives. It has been designed to be formulated, with a wide range of filler types, into D1 tile adhesives. It acts as a binder for use in EN 12004-1and2: 2017 D1 CTAs, economic exterior and interior coatings, fence stains and flat paints.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-013
data.description: Texicryl® 13-013 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion containing a plasticizer. The product gives excellent adhesion on substrates and even at low temperature, the flexibility is good. It is suitable for paints, sealants, acrylics, highly filled putties and soft fillers applications.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-073
data.description: Texicryl® 13-073 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion, designed primarily for the production of flexible, water-resistant ceramic tile adhesives. This emulsion is especially suitable for floor tile adhesives and also used in the formulation of primer systems. It controls the porosity and aids adhesion to the base substrates.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-620
data.description: Texicryl® 13-620 is an APEO free pure acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in the building and construction industry. The polymer offers improved adhesion to various substrates and superior elasticity to relevant mixtures. It is designed for use in flexible mineral sealings, crack-bridging systems, waterproof coatings, fillers, putties, polymer-modified cement and mortar based mixtures of all kinds.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-616
data.description: Texicryl® 13-616 is a self crosslinking acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in high performance coatings. It is designed for use in high performance coatings with superior water, chemical and blocking resistance. It meets all environmental demands, such as low VOC, APEO-free and formaldehyde-free with no compromise on quality and performance.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-645
data.description: Texicryl® 13-645 is a high effiency styrene acrylic binder which exhibits excellent resistance to water blanch. It is a general purpose styrene acrylic binder which exhibits excellent resistance to water blanch. Texicryl®  13-645 has a low surfactant content which helps to minimise rheology modifier use in a compounded system.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-682
data.description: Texicryl® 13-682 is the APEO free Styrene Acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in high performance roof coating compounds and in a wide range of water-based paints. It is specifically recommended for the formulation of roof mastics and waterproofing compounds. It has exceptional water resistance after drying yet good water vapour transmission. Compounds made with Texicryl® 13-682 stand up to prolonged ponded water conditions.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-691
data.description: Texicryl® 13-691 is an APEO free styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in a variety of coating compounds and in a wide range of water-based paints and waterproofing compounds. Also used as a flexible water resistant binder for use in EN 12004:2001 D2 (class AA) ceramic tile adhesives and ceramic floor tile adhesives.

data.name: Texicryl® 17-0330
data.description: Texicryl® 17-0330 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in high performance adhesives, inks, and coatings where flexibility and/or cold temperature flexibility are desired. It can be utilized in a range of water based adhesives and emulsion paint formulations and can easily be formulated into coatings varying in properties from semi-gloss finish to high pigment volume concentration low-cost paints.

data.name: Texicryl® TD8449
data.description:
Texicryl® TD8449 is a styrene acrylic binder which exhibits excellent stain blocking properties and gives good results for lipstick, highlighter pen and general marker pen stains. It has shown promising results in a simple formulation for the following:

Tannin stain blocking
Marker stain blocking

data.name: Texicryl® 13-814
data.description: Texicryl® 13-814 is a styrene acrylic copolymer aqueous dispersion with excellent flexibility and adhesion properties. It is suitable for use as the main binder in flexo or gravure inks and has good clarity so is suitable for offset overprint. This acrylic dispersion will also be suitable to compound into barrier coatings, as it exhibits very low MVTR and Cobb values.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-819
data.description: Texicryl® 13-819 is a styrene acrylate based vehicle designed for high gloss heat resistant overprint varnishes. It has been designed for use in hard polymers normally used in the formulating of overprint varnishes, and it can be blended into OPV’s to partially replace the hard polymer and enhance the gloss level. The product is free from APEO based surfactants.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-525
data.description: Texicryl® 13-525 is a APEO free modified styrene acrylic copolymer designed to be the main binder in the formulation of blister seal adhesives with superb graphic qualities. The polymer will suit other heat-seal applications and is also suitable as a modifying agent in natural rubber latex in cold seal applications.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-023
data.description: Texicryl® 13-023 is an aqueous dispersion of a modified styrene acrylic copolymer, used in the manufacture of high performance ceramic tile adhesives. Due to the nature of its special emulsifier system, it is possible to use Texicryl® 13-023 with various fillers (silicas, calcium carbonate, microdol etc). It functions as a high performance water resistant binder for EN 12004-1 and 2: 2017 D2 CTAs and fix grouts.

data.name: Texicryl® S-12
data.description: Texicryl® S-12 is a styrene acrylic resin soluble in alkalis, developed for water-based coatings and inks. It comes in solid form and enhances the gloss and resolubility of water-based coatings for the graphic arts industry. Optimum pigment grinding is achieved by making resin solutions at 30 - 35% solids content, while clear coatings require maximum solids for the highest achievable film build.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-526
data.description: Texicryl® 13-526 is a high performance, water-based, styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion with high pigment binding properties. This acrylic dispersion is specifically designed to be used in cold seal adhesive applications. The polymer shows excellent early water resistance when applied to surfaces.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-527
data.description: Texicryl® 13-527 is a high performance, water-based, styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion with high pigment binding properties. This acrylic dispersion is specifically designed to be used in cold seal adhesive applications. The polymer can be used in combination with Texicryl® 13-528 to achieve desired properties.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-528
data.description: Texicryl® 13-528 is a soft, high performance styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use in cold seal adhesive applications. This water based acrylic copolymer is specifically designed for the use in the modification of adhesion characteristics of latex based adhesives.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-619
data.description: Texicryl® 13-619 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for formulation of co-solvent free construction adhesives. It can be used in the formulation of high performance water resistant tile adhesives, fix and grouts and general purpose fillers. It meets all environmental demands, such as low VOC, APEO-free and formaldehyde-free with no compromise on quality and performance.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-314
data.description: Texicryl® 13-314 is an acrylic copolymer emulsion designed for use as a thickener in aqueous-based systems. It can be hydrolyzed under alkaline conditions for this purpose. The product must be stored in the original, unopened, undamaged containers in a dry place at temperatures between 5°C and 30°C.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-078
data.description: Texicryl® 13-078 is a styrene acrylic copolymer emulsion, designed primarily as a binder for high performance ceramic tile adhesives. It has been designed to be formulated with a wide range of filler types into water resistant tile adhesives and grouts.

data.name: Texicryl® 13-828
data.description: Texicryl® 13-828 is a highly efficient alkali swellable emulsion designed for water-based printing ink formulations. The product has been designed for use in flexographic inks for corrugated board. It is also suitable as a pigment grinding medium and let down vehicle.

data.name: Texicryl® 4025
data.description: Texicryl® 4025 is an alkali swellable emulsion designed for waterbased printing ink formulations. This emulsion is cross-linkable with thermoset resins, compatable with solvents and other resin systems. It is suitable for inks used on absorbent substrates such as packaging materials and wallpapers. It can also be used in bottle labeling adhesives.

Scott Bader is an employee-owned global manufacturer of advanced composites, structural adhesives and functional polymers. Established in 1921, we have a century of expertise in manufacturing high-quality, innovative products for a variety of markets around the world. Scott Bader now employs 800 people across 7 manufacturing sites and 18 offices worldwide.

Scott Bader is committed to expanding its global reach, with recent ventures including North America, India, Japan, and Australia, while continuing to build on its reputation for innovation, outstanding quality and technical expertise.

This is only the beginning.

ROW.TITLE: Knowde Software

0.TITLE: Knowde for Suppliers

1.TITLE: Knowde for Distributors
1.DESCRIPTION: Delight both your principals and your customers with a modern online experience that differentiates your brand and accelerates business growth.

0.TITLE: Master Data Management Platform

TOOLTIP.TITLE: Why is this important?
TOOLTIP.PARAGRAPH_I: Knowde is a B2B platform where customers and suppliers conduct business online. Using a business email address demonstrates the legitimacy of your company and commercial intent, and you are much more likely to receive responses to your requests.
TOOLTIP.PARAGRAPH_II: You can still use a personal email but you may have additional company verification steps before getting access to all of {companyName}'s features.

PAYWALL.TITLE_1: Get new products to market faster with a free Knowde Marketplace account
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_1: Gain instant access to our marketplace of over 250,000 chemicals, ingredients and polymers from 8,000 suppliers. Browse, search, and filter to quickly compare products, find information, request documents, order samples, and get quotes directly from suppliers.
PAYWALL.TITLE_2: The fastest way to find the right raw materials for your products
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_2: Search and filter over 250,000 chemicals, ingredients and polymers, access documents and download starter formulations. Interact with over 8,000 suppliers whose representatives are ready to help. Sign up for a free Knowde Marketplace account today.
PAYWALL.DESCRIPTION_3: Create a free account to gain instant access to our marketplace of over 250,000 products and their documents.
